summary: In this context, Leukotriene B4 (LTB4) is discussed in relation to its unique ability to activate BK channels, highlighting its distinct structural features compared to other leukotrienes. The text suggests that LTB4's hydroxyl group facilitates its interaction with the BK channel, indicating a specific drug interaction mechanism. This emphasizes the importance of LTB4 in pharmacological contexts, particularly regarding its role in channel activation and potential therapeutic implications.
